meanings.definition: A type of grass commonly used for forage or turf.
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted ryegrasses in the field for the cows to eat.
meanings.sent2: The golf course was covered in lush ryegrasses.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to eat the ryegrasses on the soccer field.
meanings.sent4: The ryegrasses swayed gently in the breeze, creating a soothing sight.
meanings.sent5: The bright green color of the ryegrasses stood out against the brown soil.

meanings.sent1: The meadow was filled with ryegrasses, swaying in the wind.
meanings.sent2: She bought a bag of ryegrasses to plant in her garden.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the ryegrasses were a forest for their toy animals.
meanings.sent4: The ryegrasses in the park whispered secrets to each other.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh-cut ryegrasses filled the air on the farm.
